topics.body:
. . . *reads news about so called "wave of illegal immigration"*
. . . . . . Can the news please just once run a news story without fucking up?  Please?

If you're wondering what I mean by this is that in case you've been reading our deporter in chief has been drumming up trying to get support for four billion dollars towards border security.

The immediate logical fallacy of this is that the recent surge in illegal immigration isn't coming from Mexico; instead it's coming from Asia.  The other immediate fallacy of this is that the usa has a estimated ~11 million illegal immigrants and to put it bluntly deporting that many people would bankrupt the USA.

The most likely outcome of all this is the status quo will continue with millions of illegal immigrants continuing to live in the usa and having kids in the usa with their kids because of being born in the usa will be citizens of the usa.



Also in the news:
Introducing the WP5 robot:
!http://cdn.singularityhub.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/robot-pepper-picker-1.jpg!
Basically the WP5 is a new robot being worked on that will essentially make picking vegetables or fruits by workers obsolete.

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c4565a6368727c87300000#post_53c4565a6368727c87300000
[bq="Whatevs"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c454d96368720cc93a0100#post_53c454d96368720cc93a0100
Confused. So we clearly wont need the workers so shouldnt we not accept them if they cannot find enployment. [/bq]
I wasn't saying whether or not we shouldn't accept them; rather it's logistically impossible to deport all illegal immigrants.

To use a analogy it's like talking about the logistics of building a skyscraper so high it reaches the moon; when you're talking about why it's logistically impossible you're not debating whether or not we should try to build it rather you're debating that it's logistically impossible to do so.

How about FUCK NO?

[bq="Whatevs"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c457476368727c35a50000#post_53c457476368727c35a50000
But, one can keep more out. Because if the manual labor market is going to get smaller one needs to keep people who would simply be destitute out.

[/bq]
The only way such a undertaking could possibly be achieved is if we lived in "1984" in which personal freedoms do not exist and privacy does not exist or if you just put a bullet in anyone's head that didn't have a ID card on them during constant random police checks into people's houses.

That would probably be the most efficient way of combating illegal immigration, just put a bullet through every person that lacks a ID card's heads on the spot.
